column1: Rhabdomyosarcoma is a cancerous (malignant) tumor of the muscles that are attached to the bones.
Rhabdomyosarcoma is the most common soft tissue tumor in children.
Some children with certain birth defects are at an increased risk.
Some families have a gene mutation that increases this risk.
Other symptoms vary depending on location of the tumor: - Tumors in the nose or throat may cause bleeding, congestion, swallowing problems, or neurological problems if they extend into the brain.
- Tumors around the eyes may cause bulging of the eye, problems with vision, swelling around the eye, or pain.
- Tumors in the ears, may cause pain, hearing loss, or swelling.
